page.title: 16NATIONAL TRUST IN W.WIGHT
page.content: Formed in 1907 by the National Trust Act,the full title is:_ National Trust for places of Histroic Interest or Natural Beauty.It is the largest private landowner and conservation society in Britain.All are open to the public.Many of the houses and buildings are given to the Trust by former owners.Also it relies on the public for the source of income.On the island the Trust owns mostly open space + a few buildings.The properties owned by the Trust/open to the public are Mottistone Manor,the Town Hall at Newtown,the Needles old Battery and Bembridge windmill.In West Wight they own large areas at Newtown,Mottistone, Compton,Afton;East Afton Down,Brook Down,Compton Farm,Compton Bay cliffs, Brook cliffs,Tennyson Down,West High Down, Warren Farm and Headon Warren. Martin Peter Smith 8 years
